Well, you can make them short, so that Kerals would have to hop between them. As for climbing sideways - that works. I've tested it multiple times while erecting 25m high tower on my Tylo base.

One more request - air craffic control lower looking module, doesn't matter if the bottom would be 2.5 or 1.25 meters. Basically, take a cupola, flip it upside down, extend so that the side windows are as high as a Kerbal, and add an attachment node in place of the round window.

Also, looking forward to connected IVA mod all the passable parts need at least simple IVAs.

If possible, could we get a planetary cargo bay piece? In the same sort of idea as the stock cargo bays, I imagine the part having a pair of two piece ramps that when folded, match the outline of the other base parts. After unfolding, you would have effectivly a large flat plate, about the same length as a habitat piece on top of which you could have various components ready and waiting. Reason I ask is because I would love it if I had an indoor/outdoor storage option for any rovers I plan to bring to my base. The service bay is usable, but is far to restricting in terms of size to be ideal for the role.

Love the mod! I'm gonna leave bases everywhere possible, including on the class E asteroid i'm putting in orbit of the mun for a mission ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Uhm RPM has been supported for a long time now. The small gangway airlock already has the airlock handle (double click on the right airlock and the Kerbal is send EVA). The configs for the two new ones are coming with the next release.

The Transparent windwos are also already implemented. They are just disabled by default because of the still high influence on performance. You can enable it when you right click on a part and change the pod-transparency. (When you don't have that option in the right-click menu then update RPM, its a new feature of it)

So, to confirm, the parts 'promised' (Not that you owe us anything, haha) for the next release apparently include:

- The new central hub, which holds more kerbals

- A cargo-bay type module (presumably like the service bay, but with unfolding roof)

- A utility module 'end cap'
